TLINE.TDLINE: &Purchasing Documents for Vendors&
&PURPOSE&
The report ZMIMR004 generates a list of purchasing documents satisfying
the condictions specified from the selection screen. The report is
modified from program SAPFM06L (Transaction ME2L).
RM06EL00 ZMIMR004 report on purchasing document (main program)
----- ZNMIM008 common data (parameters)
SAPFM06L ZNMIM007 module pool (main)
FM06LTOP ZNMIM009 module pool (data declaration section)
FM06LFSL ZNMIM006 module pool (include)
The menu path to reach the SAP-delivered version of this report is:
Logistics/Material Management/Purchasing/Purchase Order/Reporting/
Purch Info. system
Environment/Document Info/Purchase Orders/By Vendor
(or transaction code ME2L)
&INTEGRATION&
&PREREQUISITES&
&FEATURES&
&SELECTION&
The following are the different selection criteria available:
Vendor
Vendor's account number which uniquely identifies a vendor
Purchasing Organization
Organizatinal unit that negotiates the general conditions of purchase
for several plants or a single plant (depending on the structure of the
company or group of companies in question).
Scope of List
The key determines whether certain information, such as the quantity
still to be delivered or still to be invoiced, is displayed with the
item data.
Selection Parameter
The selection parameter allows you, for instance, tolist out only those
purchase order items with open invoices.
Document Type
Identifier allowing differentitation between the various kinds of
purchasing document in the SAP system. On the basis of the purchasing
document type, you can, for example, distinguish between a purchase
order, an RFQ and a scheduling agreement.
Purchasing Group
Key for a buyer or a group of buyers, who is/are responsible for
certain purchasing activities.
Plant
Key for a production facility or branch office within the company (that
is, company code) You use the plant key to determine, for instance,
which plant is to receive ordered goods.
Item Category
The item category determines the field selection and, where
appropriate, whether additional data screens are shown. In addition,
it determines whether a goods receipt or invoice receipt is made.
Account Assignment Category
The account assignment category determines which account assignment
data (for example, cost centre, account number, etc) are necessary for
the item.
Item Delivery Date
Date that an item is to be delivered or the service is provided.
Validity Key Date
Enter a date that lies with the validity period of the agreement if you
want to list only those documents that are valid on that date.
Range of Coverage to
Date by which the outline agreement is likely to have been fulfilled.
The system computes this date for each agreement item. In the process,
the quantity released or scheduled to date is compared with the
agreement validity period that has elapsed to date and the likely range
of coverage thus determined.
Document Number
Number that uniquely identifies a purchasing document
Material Number
Alphanumeric key uniquely identifying the material
Material Group
Key allowing you to group together several materials or services having
the same or similar attributes and to assign them to a particular
material group.
Document Date
Date on which the purchasing document was created
International Article Number (EAN)
International Article Number/Universal Product Code. This is an
internationally standardized number that uniquely identifies the
material. This number always refers to a particular unit of measure or
type of packaging. The EAN is generally assigned by the manufacturer of
this material. In this case, the EAN also identifies the manufacturer
uniquely. A company can also assign an EAN using various "in-store"
numbering techniques. An instore-EAN is known only to the company. The
equivalent of the EAN in Americca is the UPC (Universal Price Code).
Vendor's Material Number
In most cases, the vendor uses a different number for the material than
the one used in this system. The vendor's material number can
therefore also be quoted in a purchase order for identification
purposes.
Vendor Sub-Range
Using the assignment of a vendor sub-range in the info record, the
system can reduce multiple relationships (one plant - several ordering
addresses with a vendor) to a unique one (one plant - one ordering
address per vendor sub-range)
Promotion
For each item of a purchasing document, you can specify the promotion
to which the item belongs. Depending on your system settings, special
prices and conditions that are maintained in the system for this
promotion (IS-R, Retail) are applied when a promotion number is
entered. Use of this field also allows you to create purchasing
documents on a selective basis for a vertain promotion. For example,
you can create a purchase order containing only those items that are to
be procured for one promotion.
Season
Key that identifies the season type.
Season
Key that identifies the season type
Season Year
If you have assigned a season to the material, you must also specifiy a
season year. The assignment of a season year cannot be changed
on-line. Reassignment is possible only by a special background
transaction for season processing.
Short Text
Short description of the material
Vendor Name
Name1 of the customer/vendor address.
Unit of Measure
This is a selection criteria added to the original list of selection
criteria. The report displays purchasing documents with any item
having this UofM as the order price unit.
Document Dollar Value
This is a slection criteria added to the original list of selection
criteria. The report displays purchasing documents when a document net
value falls within a specified range.
Sort Order (Ascending/Descending/Do Not Sort)
This allows the user to display the document in the desire sorted
order.
Created by
This is a selection criteria added to the original list of selection
criteria. The report displays purchasing documents created by the
specified user(s). This value is defaulted to the logon user id.
Note 1: Leaving a selection criteria blank means display the report
regardless of the value in this selection critera
Note 2: Since this is a report modified from the SAP-delivered report
for a few added functionality. For a detail explanation of the
original functionality, please refer to SAP references or documents.
&STANDARD_VARIANTS&
&OUTPUT&
&ACTIVITIES&
&EXAMPLE&
